FYI:
This album is quite hard to describe. Those songs are from various artists, but you&#039;ll never hear them play like that. It&#039;s magic, sensual, a fabulous mood. 
I&#039;ll quote Jon Hassell: "With this recording, I locate myself squarely within that aspect of music which is fundamental and irreductible: the beauty of the sound... This music created a kind of permanent technicolor oasis in my spirit _ a place where i always want to stop for a cool drink, whether from Duke Ellington and Juan Tizol&#039;s "Caravan", or Ravel or raga, or gamelan or Gil, or JoÃƒÂ£o or Joujouka _ and a place which became the underlying spring from which flowed my "fourth world" musical paragdim." 
So good! It goes beyond the trumpet, it&#039;s primitive, smoothly hypnotic. Try this journey, and let Jon Hassell make you discover charming landscapes.


Enjoy !
